page.title: 20An old house - Sheldon Hall
page.content: Sheldon Hall is the oldest building in Tile Cross. It was built at the time of Queen Elizabeth I. Most of it has been rebuilt since then. The very first Sheldon Hall was named after Anslen de Scheldon who was the Lord of the Manor in 1220. It was a moated manor house. You can still see a small part of the moat if you go into the field behind the house. Nobody lives there now. The grounds are overgrown and the house look old and needs painting. People say that the owner is going to turn part of the house into a squash courts. Some people say it is supposed to be haunted. Children call it Baldy's Mansion.
